attributes.text: Hi everyone, I know that COVID hasn‚Äôt been in the mainstream news much over the last few weeks, but we‚Äôre still very much in a pandemic. Mask up in indoor public areas. Try to stock up on your rapid tests. If you‚Äôre eligible to be vaccinated and boosted, please do.
@uche_blackstock Thank you Dr. Uche. I hope people listen.
@uche_blackstock @Tinu Just waiting on boosters to hit under 50 high risk. ü§û
@this1wierdgirl @uche_blackstock @Tinu If you're immunocompromised, then you're already eligible regardless of age! It just has to be at least 4 months past your previous vaccination.
@Echo4Resistance I'm not, just regular ol' high risk.
@this1wierdgirl Darn, seems like you should be lumped in with us still üòï sorry.
@this1wierdgirl @Echo4Resistance What is regular high risk?
@Echo4Resistance @this1wierdgirl @uche_blackstock @Tinu It's a narrow group of immunosuppressed people. But at this point it is self-ID. You can just decide for yourself and tick the box.
@this1wierdgirl @uche_blackstock @Tinu It‚Äôs there now, go get a booster! https://t.co/eyrlJRImF1
@dianeedbril @uche_blackstock @Tinu That's over 50, I need under 50, I'm "only" high risk not immunocompromised. Thanks tho
@uche_blackstock So few voices saying this in public forums anymore.
@ermarc58 @uche_blackstock Far TOO few‚Ä¶
@uche_blackstock Doc people are out here actin' like COVID just packed up and left and its all good again, and I.... https://t.co/z1jgehwSo3
@Shes_deathProof @uche_blackstock U should look at data more https://t.co/Xv9sqeCVty

@whohead1 @Shes_deathProof @uche_blackstock From a metanalysis of long Covid studies: ‚Äúmore than half of COVID-19 survivors experienced PASC 6 months after recovery. The most common PASC involved functional mobility impairments, pulmonary abnormalities, and mental health disorders.‚Äù

https://t.co/HBN62Za5ih
@Shes_deathProof @uche_blackstock Yes‚Ä¶ very few masks on at the grocery today. VERY few!

‚Ä¶and  I definitely need to acknowledge that many of these are not options for people who are uninsured and underinsured we don‚Äôt have single payer universal healthcare and Congressional funding has ended which is unconscionable. 

#MedicareForAll
*since we don‚Äôt have‚Ä¶
@uche_blackstock Thanks for keeping this health crises  in our collective consciousness!

@uche_blackstock I mostly live in Canada where there is universal Healthcare. In the largest province of Ontario, there hasn't been  free PCR testing since last year. Testing even before then was nowhere close to the kind of accessibility you have in NYC for example.

@uche_blackstock Would like to add that being boosted doesn't mean we can unmask. It's just an extra level of precaution SHOULD you get COVID as boosted individuals are less likely to get hospitalized.
@uche_blackstock Yes to all of this. So frustrating we do t have clear leadership truthfully telling people what is happening and how to best navigate it. So much avoidable harm.
@uche_blackstock Covid is definitely still here.  After 2 years of masking, vaccinations, and a Booster, I just tested positive‚Ä¶‚Ä¶shit.

@uche_blackstock Ending of Congressional funding - especially for those vulnerable and uninsured, will actually prolong and worsen the pandemic for ALL, but will be especially hard on the vulnerable. A terrible decision by Congress.
@uche_blackstock Thank YOU for this-- health equity is a goal worth fighting for... üßø
@uche_blackstock Can you please be the CDC director?!
@uche_blackstock Yes, get that fourth shot. I had to cancel my appt because .... ya know .... covid.
@uche_blackstock @ENirenberg Thanks https://t.co/D1P7KQ19LM
@uche_blackstock Thx for helping with my frustration. Do you recommend crops switching booster, ie Prizer 3x then Moderna 2nd booster?

@RaphaelHP1 @uche_blackstock My dads doctor suggested dad switch to Moderna booster after two Pfizer shots, if he had choice.   He did.  I had already taken my third Pfizer with the booster but will probably switch it up for the second booster
@uche_blackstock Amen to this doc. My husband and I were talking about getting our 2nd booster üíâthis week and we stay maxed ‚úäüèæüò∑‚ù§Ô∏è
@uche_blackstock Lady, do you think anyone on the planet isn‚Äôt aware? Find another way to validate yourself.
@uche_blackstock Not a chance in hell. I am done with masks and done with covid boosters, and there's not a single thing on earth you or "public health" can do to convince me otherwise.
@uche_blackstock Umm, no.
@uche_blackstock Heard. üëÇüèæ

@uche_blackstock Do you know of any community resource sharing or even cross-state resource sharing for rapid tests and KN95 masks?  For those of us with access that want to make our access (and any resources given to us for free) available to others?

@uche_blackstock @Lnonblonde Hi, Dr. Blackstock: can you advise the best time period for taking the rapid tests? For example, if you went to an event where many were unmasked & want to test for infection, how many days after the event is a good ballpark? Thanks!
@kincaid323 @uche_blackstock @Lnonblonde Not a doctor, but from what I‚Äôve read. Omicron is 3-5 days after exposure. Alpha is closer to 5-6. Two rapid tests, with one taken 24 hours after the first

@PolarDisco @kincaid323 @uche_blackstock @Lnonblonde Tested positive on Monday two weeks ago... the previous Friday, I took a home test, a rapid test, and a PCR (long story). ALL we negative. So that testing after a couple more days, esp. if still feeling symptoms is crucial.
@uche_blackstock @QuentonKristin I have lived and survived in my ‚Äúignore Covid‚Äù bubble for the past two years, during which I have lived my best life ever.
@uche_blackstock Also, be sure to check your privilege for Covid too. It lurks everywhere. Stay safe, guys ‚ù§Ô∏è
@uche_blackstock F tests. People need to be stocking up on food!
@uche_blackstock How about learning to live with covid as we have done other viruses in the past?

@uche_blackstock COVID?

Never heard of it.

@uche_blackstock No. 

Stay home, save lives Karen.
@uche_blackstock Whats the plan to do this forever
@uche_blackstock @ENirenberg I‚Äôm going to go out to eat tho. Indoors sometimes too

@uche_blackstock Iceland, Taiwan - never did the dumb stuff (business / schools closures, house arrest of uninflected), did a lot of smart stuff (track & trace, isolation of infected, border control) - got superior results and not living with consequences of lockdown
@uche_blackstock I got my second boost!

@uche_blackstock Do you recommend vaccines and boosters for those who suffered a vaccine injury? What if one‚Äôs family was used by a secret scientific research like the Tuskegee study. Should they just trust the government again? Are there any reasons you would not recommend getting jabbed?

@uche_blackstock Avoid crowds as much as possible, especially indoors, mask up when indoors or in crowds, be fully vaccinated and boosted - and if you test positive, please avoid contact with others(!).
@uche_blackstock None of which will stop you from getting covid but whatever
@JuliaTfola @uche_blackstock Not meant to. It‚Äôs meant to keep it from getting serious enough to require hospitalization if you catch it.
@JuliaTfola @uche_blackstock Oh, and to keep you from dying.

@olyjoanne @JuliaTfola hospitalization and death are remote risks for most people who are boosted 

the time for masks is over

@6Galatians @olyjoanne @JuliaTfola It‚Äôs remote fir everyone healthy

@JuliaTfola @uche_blackstock Not absolutes. But it changes the odds.
@uche_blackstock @DrJaimeFriedman Boosters!  Let‚Äôs go people!
@uche_blackstock Already did the last thing so no to the rest
@uche_blackstock Won't stop. Can't stop.

@uche_blackstock Back to school tomorrow after a 2 week break- been enjoying photos of family adventures, get togethers, even some overseas travels- lets mix that all together with no masking, what could go wrong‚Ä¶ ü§¶üèª‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

@uche_blackstock If you don‚Äôt mind me asking, do your kids still wear masks in school? I still wear mine and, as of last week, 100% of my students still wear them. Wondering what doctors are having their children do.

@Drbenderignacio @D75TeacherNYC @uche_blackstock I am admittedly jealous of this attitude. As soon as the school district mandate was released, masks were gone everywhere except medical facilities.

@D75TeacherNYC @uche_blackstock My 13 and 15 are still masking.  I think they are but a handful still doing it. 13‚Äôs best friend & who he sits next to on bus turned + last week.  Thankful for the üò∑.  Total of 3 in his grade now + in 4 days. Weekly school testing is tomorrow.

Do have any option as to when you think that masks won't be "needed?"
@DCDoc33 @D75TeacherNYC @uche_blackstock It is Amazing you STILL haven‚Äôt caught on lmao

@uche_blackstock Our household (including 6 kids, 2 working and 4 in shared custody) managed to avoid it all this time, but it came this weekend. SO went to the first social gathering since 3/20 (colleague's retirement at a restaurant in a private room), and he tested positive yesterday.
@uche_blackstock And the threat of #LongCovid is greater than ever. I‚Äôm 3 months in and wouldn‚Äôt wish this on anyone. The long term debilitating health impact is enormous.
